Instrument.name: VLT Imager and Spectrometer for mid-Infrared (VISIR)
Instrument.description: The VLT spectrometer and imager for the mid-infrared (VISIR) was built by CEA/DAPNIA/SAP and NFRA/ASTRON, and is located at the Cassegrain focus of UT3 (Melipal). It provides diffraction-limited imaging at high sensitivity in three mid-infrared (MIR) atmospheric windows: the M-band at 5µm, the N-band between 8 to 13μm and the Q band between 17 and 20μm, respectively. In addition, it features a long-slitspectrometer with a range of spectral resolutions between 150 and 30000.
